column2: I'm unable to fetch real-time data or generate a CSV file. However
column3: I can provide a Python script that can be used to fetch the data and generate the "nasdaq_stocks.csv" file. Here's how you can do it:

column1: # Get the list of all NASDAQ tickers

This script uses the yfinance library to fetch stock data from Yahoo Finance. It first downloads a list of all NASDAQ tickers
column2: then fetches the desired data for each ticker and stores it in a DataFrame. Finally
column3: it saves the DataFrame to a CSV file.
